Class ClientConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClientConnection

  • public class ClientConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    A ClientConnection is an abstract representation of a TCP client socket that sends and receives data from a server. This class provides very basic functionality to communicate with a ServerProxy. Changing the destination address of the server would require a new
    Since:
    1.8
    See Also:
    ServerProxy

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClientConnection(java.lang.String IP, int port)
      The constructor for this class requires the IPv4 address and listening port number of a receiving server machine.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getServerIP()
      Returns the IPv4 address of the server associated with this ClientSocket.
      int getServerPort()
      Returns the listening port number of the server associated with this ClientSocket.
      boolean sendString(java.lang.String data)
      Attempts to send a String to the server.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientConnection

        public ClientConnection(java.lang.String IP,
                        int port)
        The constructor for this class requires the IPv4 address and listening port number of a receiving server machine.
        Parameters:
        IP - the IPv4 address of the server, eg. "127.0.0.1"
        port - the port being listened to on the server
        Since:
        1.8

    • Method Detail

      • sendString

        public boolean sendString(java.lang.String data)
        Attempts to send a String to the server. The String is written as a sequence of bytes via DataOutputStream.writeBytes(String), thus not requiring a newline terminator. Returns true if the server successfully received the String and sent an acknowledgement back to this socket.
        Parameters:
        data - the String being sent to the server
        Returns:
        true if the server received the String, false if otherwise
        Since:
        1.8

      • getServerIP

        public java.lang.String getServerIP()
        Returns the IPv4 address of the server associated with this ClientSocket.
        Returns:
        String representation of the server IP
        Since:
        1.8

      • getServerPort

        public int getServerPort()
        Returns the listening port number of the server associated with this ClientSocket.
        Returns:
        port number
        Since:
        1.8
